Reduced healthcare costs: With faster healing and reduced need for medical intervention, healthcare expenses would be significantly lowered.
Increased quality of life: Not having to deal with chronic pain, decreased mobility, and physical limitations would greatly improve quality of life.
Advancements in tissue engineering: New research on how stars evolve would lead to advancements in tissue engineering, further improving treatments for injuries and diseases.

Ethical considerations: While the ability to regenerate limbs is incredibly beneficial, ethical questions arise. Would this technology be accessible to everyone? How would limitations in resources affect access to this technology?

Increased scientific knowledge: Studying how stars regenerate their limbs may provide us with new insights into tissue regeneration and regenerative medicine, which could help us overcome existing limitations in this field.
